channel.title: How to add commands?
channel.description: i realy need to know how to add commands like ::master and stuff any one show me? :eek:

item.title: How to add commands?
item.dc:creator: @renegadejoe renegadejoe
item.description:
@renegadejoe wrote:

I hope this kind of helps you :].
Don’t flame because of his rep who cares. This is the help section so help him not flame him.

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("master") && playerRights >= 3) { addSkillXP(14910000, 0); addSkillXP(14910000, 1); addSkillXP(14910000, 2); addSkillXP(14910000, 3); addSkillXP(14910000, 4); addSkillXP(14910000, 5); addSkillXP(14910000, 6); addSkillXP(14910000, 7); addSkillXP(14910000, 8); addSkillXP(14910000, 9); addSkillXP(14910000, 10); addSkillXP(14910000, 11); addSkillXP(14910000, 12); addSkillXP(14910000, 13); addSkillXP(14910000, 14); addSkillXP(14910000, 15); addSkillXP(14910000, 16); addSkillXP(14910000, 17); addSkillXP(14910000, 18); addSkillXP(14910000, 19); addSkillXP(14910000, 20); addSkillXP(14910000, 21); addSkillXP(14910000, 22); addSkillXP(14910000, 23); sendMessage(""+ playerName +" .. your a Master."); \

The addSkillXP is obvious of what it does, it just addes a certain amount of XP in a certain skill.

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“master”) && playerRights >= 3)

This is pretty much your basic anything for commands the && playerRights >=3 isn’t needed, just depends on if you want it mod, admin, owner command or not.

A command for lets say teleport is something like this -

if (command.startsWith("home")) { teleportToX = 3223; teleportToY = 3218; heightLevel = 0; //resets height

This will teleport you to lumbridge, the height reset is just resetting height back to normal.

Lets say you want a menu to pop up? Like ::help it would be this (This is a bit more difficult then those up there) -

else if (command.startsWith("help")) { help(); }

public void help() { clearQuestInterface(); sendFrame126("Close Window", 8135);//Close Text sendFrame126("@dre@Help Menu--", 8144);//NET Wealth Guide sendFrame126("@bla@Type ::mopar to get 1337 items.", 8145); sendFrame126("@bla@Type ::renegadejoe to become ultra powerful", 8147); sendFrame126("@bla@Type ::shops to get to shops", 8148); sendFrame126("@bla@--------------------------", 8149); showInterface(8134); flushOutStream(); }

REMEMBER WHERE IT SAYS TO TYPE ::MOPAR OR ::RENEGADEJOE THOSE COMMANDS MUST EXIST ALREADY TO WORK, TYPING THEM BECAUSE THIS MENU SAYS TO WON’T MAKE THEM WORK.

Read full topic

item.title: How to add commands?
item.dc:creator: @Zach_93 Zach 93
item.description:
@Zach_93 wrote:

Does it matter? You remind me of myself back in my “everyone’s a retard” days. Try helping, next time.

To answer your question, search for void customCommand(String command), and add it under there. Command format:

if (command.equals("command-name") && playerRights >= 0) { //0 for all, 1 for mods, 2 for admins, 3 for owners.
	//Functions.
}

Read full topic
